humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the pathology report, sentinel lymph node #1 has a microscopic cluster of tumor cells within a capsular lymphatic vessel, while nodes #2 and #3 are benign and show no evidence of metastatic tumor. This indicates that there is metastases in 1 out of 3 assessed sentinel lymph nodes (N1) as per the AJCC staging system.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The patient's pathology report indicates that there is a sentinel lymph node (SLN #1) with microscopic clusters of tumor cells (approximately 8 cells, less than 0.2 mm) within a capsular lymphatic vessel (Diagnosis 1). This is consistent with metastasis in a sentinel lymph node, which corresponds to N1 staging. The other two sentinel lymph nodes (SLN #2 and SLN #3) do not show any evidence of metastatic tumor (Diagnosis 2 and 3). Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N1.
